channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8341881] [REDO] java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTime.java#tmp fails on alinux3
item.description:
Test java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTime.java#tmp fails, the log snippet:
STDOUT:
/tmp/name11404038214856886703 supportsCreationTimeRead == true
STDERR:
java.lang.RuntimeException: Creation time should not have changed
        at CreationTime.test(CreationTime.java:127)
        at CreationTime.main(CreationTime.java:154)

To reproduce the fails, test command on most linux system:
rm -rf /dev/shm/tmp/ ; jtreg -v:fail,error -w /dev/shm/tmp -nr test/jdk/java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTime.java#cwd

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
[jdk17u-fix-request] Approval Request from sendaoYan
Clean backport to fix the test bug which cause test fails at some linux distro. Change has been verified locally, test-fix only, no risk.

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk17u-dev/pull/3159
Date: 2024-12-21 09:06:27 +0000

[jdk21u-fix-request] Approval Request from sendaoYan
Fix test bug which cause test fails on some Linux distribution. The change has been verified locally, risk is low.

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/pull/1068
Date: 2024-10-19 08:00:47 +0000

[jdk23u-fix-request] Approval Request from sendaoYan
Clean backport to fix the test bugs which cause test fails on some environments, test-fix only.

I have create a new PR to fix the build failure on Alpine. https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/pull/21522
In theroy, if Alpine doesn't have 'statx system call', then 'linuxIsCreationTimeSupported' in 'test/jdk/java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTimeHelper.java' will return false because 'abi.defaultLookup().find("statx").isPresent()' is false, then this test will continue to run. So in theroy this test will run normally after pr21522

Maybe the whole test needs to be disabled for now on Alpine because it states in the coding of test/jdk/java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/libCreationTimeHelper.c :
"struct statx used by statx system call on >= glibc 2.28"
But on Alpine we do not have glibc.

Btw on RHEL and SUSE Linux I find the comment in bits/types.h :
/*
 * Never include this file directly; use <sys/types.h> instead.
 */
And sys/types.h is available on Alpine. So it seems including this is not recommended on the standard distros .
We build with an Alpine 3.17 Dockerfile (FROM alpine:3.17). In a non Docker Alpine env (3.19) the header bits/types.h is also not present.
I can reproduce the compile fail on Alpine by docker image adoptopenjdk/alpine3_build_image

This fails to compile on Alpine (or is just another package needed?)

/priv/jenkins/client-home/workspace/openjdk-jdk-linux_alpine_x86_64-opt/jdk/test/jdk/java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/libCreationTimeHelper.c:29:10: fatal error: bits/types.h: No such file or directory
   29 | #include <bits/types.h>
      | ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk23u/pull/165
Date: 2024-10-14 15:07:34 +0000

Changeset: f56a1541
Branch: master
Author: SendaoYan <syan@openjdk.org>
Date: 2024-10-14 12:32:55 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/f56a154132f7e66b1b65adfa2aa937119999b14a

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/21462
Date: 2024-10-11 03:14:40 +0000
It could be that only the test was run and not the builds themselves, so this slipped through.

[~chagedorn] That's interesting. During review of JDK-8338884 [~bpb] mentioned that the patch passed on all Oracle platforms. Not sure if this included the build part. See: https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/pull/20687#issuecomment-2400569620
It's was a build problem (see JDK-8341882). Maybe you can reach out to the build experts if you're having problems to reproduce this.
